meanings.definition: Resembling cork in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The corklike material was soft and buoyant.
meanings.sent2: The hat had a corklike feel to it.
meanings.sent3: She joked that his hair looked corklike after swimming.
meanings.sent4: The clouds had a corklike texture, fluffy and light.
meanings.sent5: The corklike fabric was gentle against her skin.

meanings.sent1: The corklike stopper fit perfectly in the bottle.
meanings.sent2: The corklike tree bark was easy to carve.
meanings.sent3: He pretended to have corklike qualities when he refused to sink in the pool.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a corklike quality, warm and comforting.
meanings.sent5: The corklike material was durable and long-lasting.

meanings.definition: Like cork in nature or quality.
meanings.sent1: The corklike texture of the wall was smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The corklike flooring was easy to clean.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring had a corklike sound to it.
meanings.sent4: His smile was corklike, always bouncing back from setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The corklike properties of the material made it ideal for insulation.
